business.headline: Explained: Why IMF is facing criticism for granting $1 billion loan to PakistanThe disbursement, approved on Friday under the Extended Fund Facility (EFF), raises total payouts under the programme to $2.1 billion. But the timing of the announcement has provoked a fierce backlash.

India–Pakistan tensions escalate. What's next for Dalal Street investors?While the Sensex and Nifty ended over 1% lower in the previous session, experts suggest that the decline was far less than what could have been expected in such a volatile environment.

Nirmala Sitharama asks banks to stay on alert amid rising Indo-Pak tensionsThe directive comes a day after India successfully intercepted multiple missile and drone attacks launched from Pakistan late on May 8. While India reported no major damage, the government has since asked all critical institutions to bolster their cybersecurity infrastructure in anticipation of potential retaliatory attacks.
'Unsupportive stance towards India': Go Homestays ends ties with Turkish AirlinesGo Homestays ends ties with Turkish Airlines after Turkey backs Pakistan following 'Operation Sindoor'.

India-Pak tensions: Oil PSUs assure ample fuel stocks, urge against panic buyingIndian oil companies have issued statements assuring ample fuel stocks across the country. The Indian Oil Corporation and Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited have emphasised that there is no shortage of petrol, diesel, CNG, or LPG.

Bharti Airtel in talks to acquire 49% stake in Haier India: ReportSunil Mittal, the billionaire-founder of Indian telecom operator Bharti Airtel, has partnered with private equity firm, Warburg Pincus to buy a substantial stake in Haier India.

Telecom regulator recommends 5-year satellite spectrum allotment: ReportThe move comes amid growing interest in satellite internet services from global players like Elon Musk's Starlink and domestic telecom giants.
Sensex closes 880 points lower, Nifty above 24,000; Titan ends 4% upThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 880.34 points to end at 79,454.47, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 265.80 points to close at 24,008.00.

Essential goods supply to remain unaffected across India amid geopolitical heatPrices of key food items, including pulses and vegetables, are being watched closely to make sure they stay under control. Efforts are also being made to keep the supply of these items steady across all cities.

Planning an FD in 2025? Check these 6 banks offering attractive interest ratesFor fixed deposits between 15 and 21 months, HDFC Bank is offering 7.05% to general citizens, while senior citizens get 7.55%

Finance Minister to review cyber readiness of banks, financial institutionsThe meeting will bring together representatives from several key institutions like the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI), the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), the National Stock Exchange (NSE), etc.
Explained: Why Yes Bank share price jumped over 7% todayThe Yes Bank stock has now gained nearly 11% over the past five sessions, sparking investor curiosity.

entertainment.headline: Ram Charan receives warm welcome in London ahead of wax statue inauguration. PicsRam Charan's wax statue at Madame Tussauds London will be launched tomorrow. As he arrived in London, he received a loud cheers and warm welcome from his fans.

I'm nothing if not Indian: Hina Khan's strong note for trolls 'across the border'Hina Khan wrote a strongly-worded note against people 'across the border' who have been abusing her, cursing her and wishing the worst for her given her medical condition. She earlier expressed support for her country and the armed forces following Operation Sindoor against Pakistan-backed terrorism.

Indian cinema's queer journey: From margins to mainstreamIndian cinema has gradually shifted from stereotypical portrayals of queer characters to more authentic and nuanced stories. This evolution reflects broader social shifts and growing acceptance of queer identities in India.

Aamir Khan postpones Sitaare Zameen Par trailer launch amid Indo-Pak tensionsActor Aamir Khan has postponed the trailer release of his upcoming film 'Sitaare Zameen Par' amid rising India-Pakistan border tensions. The decision reflects solidarity with the armed forces and a call for national unity during sensitive times.

Raid 2 box office Day 9: Ajay's film smashes Rs 100 crore, actor's 15th in the clubAjay Devgn's 'Raid 2' has surpassed the benchmark of Rs 100 crore at the box office. The film witnessed a drop in its collection during the weekdays, given the escalating tensions between India and Pakistan. However, it continued to perform decently.

Khloe Kardashian 'loved seeing King Khan' at Met Gala, calls SRK 'amazing'Khloe Kardashian joined millions of those who think Shah Rukh Khan looked dashing in his Sabyasachi-designed look at Met Gala 2025. She shared a few photos of the superstar on Snapchat, and referred to him as 'King Khan'

'Godzilla x Kong: Supernova' Confirmed for 2027, production begins on Monsterverse SequelWarner Bros. confirms Godzilla x Kong: Supernova for March 2027 with production underway. Teaser hints at Titan activity, Monarch's return, and fan-favorite Easter eggs in the expanding Monsterverse saga.

John Cena returns in 'Peacemaker' Season 2 trailer packed With DC CameosJohn Cena returns in the action-packed Peacemaker Season 2 trailer, featuring new characters and surprise cameos. Premiering August 21 on Max, the season explores deeper emotional arcs and conflict.

Falaq Naaz questions loyalty of fellow actors towards the nation: I feel sorryTelevision actor Falaq Naaz has openly criticised Muslim actors in the Indian entertainment industry for their silence amidst the India-Pakistan conflict, urging them to show loyalty to India.

Dies Irae: Bramayugam makers announce title of horror film with Pranav MohanlalPranav Mohanlal's horror film, which will be directed by Rahul Sadasivan of 'Bramayugam' fame has finally got its title - 'Dies Irea'. It is a Latin word that means 'The Day of Wrath'.

He walked away from duties: Actor Ravi Mohan's wife in fresh note on divorce issuesActor Ravi Mohan's estranged wife, Aarti Ravi, once again shared a long note on social media, accusing the actor of emotional abandonment and financial neglect during their ongoing divorce. Her statement comes amid rumours of Ravi's alleged relationship with singer Kenishaa Francis, who has denied any romantic involvement.

Nawazuddin Siddiqui calls actors 'bhands', says fine with dancing at weddings Nawazuddin Siddiqui said he has no issue with actors dancing at weddings and called performers like himself modern-day 'bhands'. He shared that despite receiving disrespect towards artists, performance remains a respectful part of their profession.

Not all men, just Baek Ho: The Potato Lab hero who stays and rewrites romanceThey say you grow out of fairytales. But, in our weekly K-fix, we introduce you to a man - So Baek-ho from 'The Potato Lab' - who walks into a lab tucked in the hills and quietly rewrites everything you thought you knew about love.

Singer Pawandeep Rajan's health update: Undergoes three more surgeriesIndian Idol 12 winner Pawandeep Rajan underwent three more surgeries following his tragic accident on May 5. His team issued a statement and updated fans about his health.

Singer Jackson Wang's India trip may defer amid Indo-Pak tensionSinger Jackson Wang's India trip might be deferred due to escalating tensions between India and Pakistan. No official statement has been released by the global sensation yet.

Aamir Khan's Sitaare Zameen Par to follow YouTube pay-per-view model: ReportAamir Khan's upcoming film 'Sitaare Zameen Par' will be released on YouTube through a pay-per-view model, eight weeks after its theatrical release. The film introduces 10 debutant actors under the banner of Aamir Khan Productions.

Blank tweets? Amitabh Bachchan's unusual X activity raises eyebrowsVeteran actor Amitabh Bachchan's recent string of around 20 blank tweets has left fans puzzled and speculating about their significance.

Subham review: Samantha's first production delivers a sweet, offbeat horror comedyReleased-Fri May 09, 2025'Subham', Samantha Ruth Prabhu's debut production, offers a quirky, light-hearted blend of horror and comedy. Directed by 'Cinema Bandi''s Praveen Kandregula, the film tackles social themes with humour. Read our review.

Paresh Rawal dismisses 'Akshay isn't friend' statement, calls him 'cool guy'Paresh Rawal says 'maatha kharab ho gaya' after the interview in which he called Akshay Kumar 'a colleague' and 'not a friend'. The actor now comes clean on the statement.

general news.headline: Pak targets 4 air stations, India counters with precision strikes at 6 basesDuring a special briefing on the escalating conflict, Colonel Sophia Qureshi stated that Pakistan attempted to strike 26 strategic sites throughout the night, including air bases and transport hubs. A high-speed missile was also fired at an airbase in Punjab at around 1.40 am.

Pak moving troops into forward areas, Indian forces on alert: GovernmentIndia-Pakistan conflict: After Pakistan targeted 26 military locations across four states, the government said India carried out precision strikes at four Pakistani airbases.

Live: Pak used high-speed missile to target Punjab airbase at 1:40 amOperation Sindoor news: India launched precision strikes overnight on four key Pakistani airbases - Noor Khan in Rawalpindi, Murid in Chakwal, and Rafiqui in Shorkot - causing heavy damage to military infrastructure and assets, government sources confirmed on Saturday. 
The operation followed a series of drone attacks from Pakistan across the border. In retaliation, India also hit terror launch pads and military posts in Pakistan-occupied Kashmir's Neelam Valley and Sialkot, which were being used to deploy tube-launched drones targeting Indian positions in Jammu, according to defence sources.
Meanwhile, Pakistan fired a long-range missile aimed at a strategic Indian site. The missile was intercepted and destroyed by Indian Air Defence Systems in the Western Sector. A full battle assessment will be released after the Ministry of External Affairs briefing later today.

India's response always responsible, remains so, S Jaishankar tells USAfter speaking with US Secretary of State Marco Rubio, Dr S Jaishankar reaffirmed India's stance, stating that its approach amid rising Indo-Pak tensions "has always been measured and responsible."

How India, with pictorial evidence, demolished Pakistan's tissue of liesTo counter the false narrative, India released time-stamped images and videos showing the airbases in full operational condition. The visuals depicted normalcy and no visible damage to the military installations targeted in Pakistani propaganda.

Pakistan's Operation Bunyan al-Marsoos: Why the name, what it meansPakistan has massively escalated the standoff with India by firing drones and missiles, including Fattah-1 ballistic missile. It has named its operation Bunyan al-Marsoos. This is a verse from the Quran. What does the name mean, and why has Pakistan named its military mission Bunyan al-Marsoos?

Why India hit 6 Pak air bases including Chaklala, Rafiqui and MuridLocated just 10 km from Islamabad, Chaklala air base is one of Pakistan's most sensitive military compounds and serves both air force operations and VIP transport.

India has moral high ground, should take strategic high ground too: Fareed ZakariaIn an interview with India Today TV, Fareed Zakaria stressed that India must act with long-term strategy in mind. "India has the moral high ground but it has the most to lose from a massive escalation," he said.

Video: Army destroys Pak posts, drone launch pads in precision strikesIndia on Friday said Pakistan had launched between 300 and 400 Turkish drones across locations from Leh to Sir Creek in its failed attempt to target Indian military installations

Virat Kohli informs BCCI he wants to retire from Tests before England tour: SourcesA top BCCI official has urged Virat Kohli to reconsider his decision after the former captain informed the board of his willingness to retire from Test cricket. India are set to tour England for a five-Test series, starting on June 20.
Army releases photos of Pakistani drone debris after neutralizing threat over AmritsarArmy releases photos of Pakistani drone debris after neutralizing threat over Amritsar

Reimbursements to devastate J&K: Omar Abdullah as IMF approves loan to PakIndia-Pakistan conflict: Taking a swipe at the global community over its persistent appeal for de-escalation, Omar Abdullah wondered how such moves, like the loan approval by the IMF to Pakistan, would aid the cause.

Videos: Pakistan targets civilians in Jammu, houses, cars damagedThe fresh escalation comes just hours after a Pakistani drone strike injured three members of a family in a civilian neighbourhood in Punjab's Ferozepur district.

Missile debris found in Haryana, Rajasthan, Punjab as Pak ramps up strikesIndia-Pakistan conflict: The development coincides with reports that Pakistan fired its Fateh-II surface-to-surface missile at a strategic Indian location.

Pak PM calls meet of nuclear command body after India hits airbases: ReportThe National Command Authority is Pakistan's highest decision-making body on national security matters, including those related to its nuclear arsenal.

J&K official killed, 2 critically injured in Pak shelling in RajouriOmar Abdullah said that Additional District Development Commissioner Raj Kumar Thappa's home was struck by Pakistani shelling targeting Rajouri.

Willing to play constructive role, says China as India-Pakistan tensions escalateCommenting on the India-Pakistan tension, Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson said China is closely following the ongoing situation between India and Pakistan and is deeply concerned about the escalation.

Sam Altman reacts to Elon Musk's dig at old Trump post, says 'let's be friends'Amid a history of public disputes, Sam Altman offered a conciliatory note after Elon Musk shared a 2016 post about Donald Trump, saying it was time to move on.

sports.headline: India men's compound team wins gold at Archery World Cup Stage 2India's compound men's team won gold, the women's team bagged silver, and the mixed team claimed bronze at the Archery World Cup Stage 2 in Shanghai—marking a successful outing and continuing their impressive form ahead of future international events.

Mohammed Afsal breaks 800m national record in UAE Athletics Grand PrixIndia's Mohammed Afsal set a new national record in the men's 800m race at the UAE Athletics Grand Prix 2025 in Dubai, clocking 1:45.61.

Confused Rishabh Pant has forgotten his best game: Sanjay BangarLucknow Super Giants captain Rishabh Pant is confused and has forgotten to play his best shots, feels former India batting coach Sanjay Bangar. Bangar has urged Pant to play more straight-batted shots in limited-overs cricket.

BCCI, please convince him to stay: Fans on Kohli's Test retirement indicationThe fans have urged the BCCI to step in and convince Virat Kohli to reconsider his decision to retire from Test cricket. Ahead of the upcoming tour of England, Kohli has reportedly informed the BCCI about his intention to step away from the longest format of the game.

PBKS, DC players arrive in Delhi from Dharamshala after IPL 2025 suspensionThe Punjab Kings and Delhi Capitals players arrived in Delhi from Dharamshala after the IPL 2025 match on May 8 was called off due to Pakistan attacks on various parts of India. The players reached Delhi in a special train arranged by the BCCI.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
